meanings.definition: Having or relating to two axes.
meanings.sent1: The biaxial crystal could refract light in two different directions.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the biaxial properties of the mineral under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The biaxial mirror made the room look like it had two separate dimensions.
meanings.sent4: Her biaxial thinking allowed her to see the problem from multiple angles.
meanings.sent5: The biaxial nature of the compass made it useful for navigation in any direction.

meanings.definition: Involving or having two axes of symmetry.
meanings.sent1: The biaxial snowflake had perfect symmetry along two different lines.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully sketched the biaxial design before painting it on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The biaxial cake was perfectly divided into two equal halves.
meanings.sent4: Her biaxial hairstyle featured two distinct layers of different lengths.
meanings.sent5: The biaxial pattern on the fabric created a visually appealing look.
